Please Note - to confirm your attendance at this event, you must register at the MIT Enterprise Forum of Cambridge website at http://www.mitforumcambridge.org/events/rfid-in-automotive-supply-chain/

What is the next breakthrough innovation in the automotive value chain? RFID applies to traceability and synchronization of supplier networks, to manufacturing processes, to logistics, to increasing the driving experience, an in customized advertisements. Experiences across the world show outstanding technology performance yet adoption is not universal. What are the main exogenous and endogenous drivers
to achieve positive ROI?

Speakers:

Toby Rush, founder and President of Rush Tracking
Toby Rush co-founded Rush Tracking Systems and serves as President and CEO. Rush Tracking Systems has a proven track record working with Fortune 100 client organizations to deliver best-in-class RFID solutions that help optimize operations.

Rush has achieved national recognition as an expert in mobile and wireless technologies, with extensive experience delivering mobile enterprise solutions in challenging and dynamic environments. He has presented extensively on RFID and mobility in the enterprise at key industry conferences.

Ricky Heath, AT&T Industry Solutions Practice Leader for Transportation

Ricky Heath has been a travel and transportation industry executive since 1980 having direct experience with all P&L related activities managing sales, marketing, operations and IT solutions organizations on a global basis. Ricky has helped airlines and other travel related companies around the world develop and execute major strategic initiatives and large scale IT projects. These initiatives include implementing reservations systems, creating distribution strategies, leading thought leadership with the development of hosting platforms, deploying e-commerce programs and marketing technology subscription models. Ricky has maintained his focus on the travel and transportation industry with 20+ years of executive leadership at Delta Air Lines and Worldspan (a global travel distribution and technology company formerly owned by Delta Air Lines, Northwest Airlines and American Airlines). He now leads AT&T’s strategic initiatives within the technology leader’s travel and transportation vertical practice.

Moderator:

Juan Pons, MIT Sloan
Juan Pons was CEO of Aida Group that implemented next generation RFID systems for the Universal Postal Union in 24+ countries.  UPU moves the most uniquely identified products in the world – 600billion – and must exchange data between 124 national postal entities (unlike FedEx or UPS which have centralized proprietary systems).
